Questions.QuestionString: At stall, the wingtip stagnation point. (Level 1)

Questions.QuestionString: The rigging angle of incidence of an elevator is. (Level 1)
Answers: the angle between the bottom surface of the elevator and the longitudinal datum.
the angle between the bottom surface of the elevator and the horizontal in the rigging position.

Questions.QuestionString: Which of the following is true?. (Level 1)
Answers: Lift acts at right angles to the relative airflow and weight acts vertically down.
Lift acts at right angles to the wing chord line and weight acts vertically down.
Lift acts at right angles to the relative air flow and weight acts at right angles to the aircraft centre line.

Questions.QuestionString: Vapour trails from the wingtips of an aircraft in flight are caused by. (Level 1)
Answers: low pressure above the wing and high pressure below the wing causing vortices.
low pressure above the wing and high pressure below the wing causing a temperature rise.
high pressure above the wing and low pressure below the wing causing vortices.

Questions.QuestionString: The chord line of a wing is a line that runs from. (Level 1)
Answers: the centre of the leading edge of the wing to the trailing edge.
half way between the upper and lower surface of the wing.
one wing tip to the other wing tip.

Questions.QuestionString: A high aspect ratio wing will give. (Level 1)
Answers: high profile and low induced drag.
low profile and high induced drag.
low profile and low induced drag.

Questions.QuestionString: The relationship between induced drag and airspeed is, induced drag is. (Level 1)
Answers: directly proportional to the square of the speed.
inversely proportional to the square of the speed.

Questions.QuestionString: What is the definition of Angle of Incidence?. (Level 1)
Answers: The angle the underside of the mainplane or tailplane makes with the horizontal.
The angle the underside of the mainplane or tailplane makes with the longitudinal datum line.
The angle the chord of the mainplane or tailplane makes with the horizontal.

P1 is greater than P2, and V1 is greater than V2.
P1 is less than P2 and V1 is greater than V2.

Questions.QuestionString: As the angle of attack decreases, what happens to the centre of pressure?. (Level 1)
Answers: Centre of pressure is not affected by angle of attack decrease.

Questions.QuestionString: A decrease in pressure over the upper surface of a wing or aerofoil is responsible for. (Level 1)

Questions.QuestionString: QNE refers to. (Level 1)
